addr: 114 West 47th Street, 9th Floor New York, New York 10003
title: China, the United States and the Future of Central Asia
desc: Since the break-up of the Soviet Union, the independent countries of Central Europe -- resource-rich and politically unstable -- have played a little-discussed role in Sino-U.S. relations. Join? David Denoon ?as he talks about the behavior and strategies of the United States and China as they compete for influence in Central Asia, drawing a comparison to Southeast Asia. His book ? China, the United States and the Future of Central Asia: Vol. I ? (2015), is part of a three-volume series on U.S.-China relations in Central Asia, Southeast Asia, and Latin America, and will be available for purchase at the?program.
